article.title: Computation of the transmitted and polarized scattered fluxes by the exoplanet HD 189733b in X-rays

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is **incorrect** about the X-ray spectrum of HD 189733A shown in Figure 2?
choices: The spectrum is obtained using the XMM-Newton/pn instrument.
The red, blue, and black lines represent the cool, warm, and total plasma components, respectively.
The peak of the cool plasma component occurs at a higher energy than the warm plasma component.
The bottom panel shows the unfolded spectrum with an energy sampling of ~5 eV.

multiple_choice_question.text: What percentage of the total counts detected in the 0.25-2.0 keV energy range have energy lower than 0.69 keV?
Figure 3 depicts the coronal electronic density versus height above the corona. What does the difference in the slope of the red and blue lines indicate?
choices: Different temperatures of the cool and warm coronal plasma.
Different chemical compositions of the cool and warm coronal plasma.
Different ionization states of the cool and warm coronal plasma.
Different magnetic field strengths in the cool and warm coronal plasma.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the coronal emission profile integrated along the line of sight. Which energy level results in the most compact coronal emission?
choices: 0.57 keV
0.70 keV
2.00 keV
All energies result in the same coronal emission size.

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following statements is **correct** based on the atmospheric model of HD 189733b shown in Figure 7?
choices: The temperature of the atmosphere decreases with increasing distance from the planet.
The pressure of the atmosphere is constant throughout the model.
The atmosphere is primarily composed of neutral Hydrogen and Helium.
The velocity of the escaping atmosphere decreases with increasing distance from the planet.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure presents the photon cross-section of photoelectric absorption in X-rays. What is the main effect of increasing metallicity on the photoelectric absorption?
choices: It significantly decreases the absorption cross-section.
It has a negligible effect on the absorption cross-section.
It increases the energy at which the absorption edges occur.
It significantly increases the absorption cross-section.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure illustrates the contribution of different atmospheric layers to the X-ray absorption. What percentage of the absorption at the X-ray absorption radius at 0.7 keV originates from atmospheric layers below z = 634 km?
This figure shows various transit light curves. Which of the following curves is characterized by a W-profile due to strong limb brightening?
choices: The photospheric transit of a uniformly emitting disk.
The chromospheric transit.
The coronal transit at 0.7 keV.
Both B and C.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the impact of increasing metallicity on the maximum transit depth in the 0.25-2 keV energy band?
choices: The transit depth significantly decreases with increasing metallicity.
The transit depth remains relatively unchanged with varying metallicity.
The transit depth significantly increases with increasing metallicity.
The transit depth becomes undetectable with increasing metallicity.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the photo-polarimetric results for HD 189733A. What causes the sharp drop to zero in the \'Reprocessed Flux\' panel?
choices: The exoplanet HD 189733b transiting in front of the star HD 189733A.
The exoplanet HD 189733b being occulted by the star HD 189733A.
The intrinsic polarization of the star HD 189733A decreasing to zero.
The X-ray instrument reaching its detection limit.
